QuestionStem: Which statements provide evidence that the cell in the diagram is a eukaryote? Select all that apply.

options.AnswerText: A. The cell has a nucleus.
B. The cell does not have a nucleus.
C. The cell has membrane-bound organelles.
D. The cell does not have membrane-bound organelles.

CorrectFeedback: Eukaryotic cells store their genetic material in a nucleus, whereas prokaryotic cells contain their genetic material throughout their cytoplasm. Eukaryotic cells have membrane-bound organelles, and prokaryotic cells do not.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Think about the differences between prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.
IncorrectFeedback: Think about the differences between prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Eukaryotic cells store their genetic material in a nucleus, whereas prokaryotic cells contain their genetic material throughout their cytoplasm. Eukaryotic cells have membrane-bound organelles, and prokaryotic cells do not.
